error.signature: ERROR: Package 'package' requires a different Python version: X.Y.Z not in '>=3.8,<3.12'

verdict.summary: The package declares a Python version range that does not include the current Python interpreter version. Either the package hasn't been updated for newer Python, or you need an older/newer Python version.

dead_ends.why_fails: The package may use syntax or stdlib features not available in the current Python version, causing runtime errors

dead_ends.action: Patch the package metadata to remove the Python version constraint
dead_ends.why_fails: Does not fix actual incompatibilities in the code; may cause subtle runtime bugs

workarounds.action: Install a version of the package compatible with your Python: pip install 'package<X.Y'
workarounds.how: pip index versions <package> to list versions, find one supporting your Python, then pip install 'package==compatible.version'

workarounds.action: Use pyenv or deadsnakes to install the required Python version
workarounds.how: pyenv install 3.11.0 && pyenv local 3.11.0 && pip install <package>
workarounds.condition: when you can change Python version

workarounds.action: Check if a newer version of the package supports your Python
workarounds.how: pip install --upgrade <package> to get the latest which may support newer Python
workarounds.condition: when running newer Python than package supports

leads_to.condition: when Python constraint eliminates many versions causing extensive backtracking

preceded_by.condition: when version search fails due to Python compatibility filtering

frequently_confused_with.distinction: Requires-python-mismatch explicitly says the Python version is wrong; no-matching-distribution may silently filter incompatible versions and report no versions found
